intro: Centaurea demirkapiensis, commonly known as the Demirkapi thistle, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually spiny and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are typically blue or purple in color. Centaurea demirkapiensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators.
